programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The twins birthday is approaching. Sour says she does not wish to share the birthday with Sweet. Sweet is sad that her sister feels that way but respects her wish. Sour initially enjoys having a birthday of her own and the activities the Berry girls plan for her, but gradually feels lonely without her sister, and regrets what she said earlier.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie, Woodsy and Scoutbadger have plans to go play with their friends, but before they go, they must bring back mushrooms for dinner. The twins grab their map indicating their secret spots to pick up mushrooms, but Rosie makes fun of them: she doesn’t need a map, thanks to her super fox sense of smell! She heads one way and the badgers go another. But none of themcan find a single mushroom worth eating!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It is a sunny Spring day in the meadow and Little Nutbrown Hare is enjoying all it has to offer. As the day wears on a heavy grey cloud forces Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse to seek shelter from the rain. Will the friends let a little water ruin their fun or will they discover that rainy days can be just as exciting.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. He’s convinced that ants are not very nice, and only after Big Nutbrown Hare explains how the ants were probably taking the berries home to their families does Little Nutbrown Hare forgive them. And when he sees how clever the ants are, he soon wants to be like them.

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Annalee and Boribon are planning a trip, but Boribon isn’t feeling well. The little bears fever rises, and he has to stay in bed. Annalee takes care of him, so the days pass quickly. Thanks to all the care and medicine, Boribon soon gets well again!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has a very bad night. He only finds sleep when he lies down on the floor in the morning. Julia finds him there and tries to understand how to get Sam back to sleeping well, in his own bed.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets remember their first days with Toto very well. They had had to teach him well, just as Mom said, but it was easier said than done, for the little dog had decided to mark his territory and refused to give his paw. At night, the kids heard him cry in his basket and wanted to reassure him, but "off to bed" had said Mom. However she was not as harsh as it seems because in the morning, guess who the Triplets found warmly tucked in their Mom’s bed?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: While strolling through the city gardens, the triplets are delighted to stumble upon a gelato street vendor. They would love to have one but « not before lunch », says Mom. The three kids try to negotiate but in vain. As she gets lost in a daydream in which she is the queen of a world made of ice cream and whipped cream, Girl does not notice that her mom and her brothers are gone. She decides to go back to the ice-cream stand. Will she be able to resist to help herself to a delicious ice cream? Of course not!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Lots of freight has arrived from the docks and Cormac is worried how he and Old Puffer Pete will get it all delivered in time. He hopes Pete has his fast wheels on today. Pete says that he doesn’t, because slow and steady is the way to go. Cormac disagrees and challenges Pete to a race. They will divide up all the deliveries and the first to finish wins.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah and Mandy film a piece for the Scoop Dooley Show, and Scoop Dooley tries to make everything more sensational.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: On a mission to rescue Luc the wild boar, Moose ends up needing a rescue himself - and the multi - vehicle rescue gives Ellie a chance to show the Fire Cadets the importance of being slow and careful in a firefighter’s tasks.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: When Kate’s ant farm breaks, she wonders how to get the ants back in their home. In Mimiloo, Lily has found hatching humming turtle eggs! Cowgirl Kate must find a way to round up the baby humming turtles and lead them to their mama in the Singing Seas.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate gets frustrated playing mini golf in the back yard. In Mimiloo, it’s Make-Up-A-Game Day, so Kate helps her friends combine the best parts of their favourite games to make up a brand new game! Mim-Mim really wants to win his very first trophy—but first, Kate will have to help him find his strengths to master the game.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: After a safety demonstration at school, Caillou goes overboard trying to accident-proof his house. But in a secret agent fantasy where an Agent (Caillou) almost fails a mission because of an actual safety bubble, Caillou realizes that accidents happen, but you can always be prepared.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: Caillou is having too much fun playing Space Captain to go to sleep, so he pretends to be Dax Turbo, trying to keep his sleepy crew awake so they can complete their mission, and learns that everyone needs time to rest and recharge, even intrepid space captains.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When railway inspectors come to the Island of Sodor, they start their inspection on Thomas’ branch line. Thomas, Annie and Clarabel are keen to show what they can do, but there are nothing but problems: a stuck window in a hot carriage, naughty schoolchildren pulling the emergency cable and animals on the line! To make matters worse one of the inspectors is very grumpy. But when Annie discovers that he’s left his gold watch on her seat, Thomas sets out to return it and that finally impresses the grumpy inspector more than anything.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a blue pansy caterpillar, and the Junior Rangers set off to find a home for it. On the way, they come upon other blue pansy caterpillars and butterflies, whose home will be destroyed soon. Can the Junior Rangers find a new home for all these blue pansies?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Ranger Rocky invites the Junior Rangers along on an adventure to return an orca to the sea. But the task becomes twice as hard when they come across a second orca that is stranded on the beach.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo is shocked to find an electric eel in the garden pond! The Junior Rangers travel to South America to return the eel to its home, but their mission takes a wild turn when they meet an anaconda.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat has to deliver a bouncy castle to Laurens class.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat is delivering a telescope to Charlie, but his satnav leads him in the wrong direction.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma have come to Bings house for lunch but there are no carrots so Flop pops to the shop to get some. Bing stays behind but its not long before he starts to miss Flop. Missing Flop... its a Bing thing!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch box, and Pando has the exact same one – match! At first it’s fun to match, but that changes when Bing and Pando mix their lunchboxes up and end up with the wrong lunch.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie find out that their favourite TV personality Sammy Starfish is playing for one night only at the Big City Auditorium. They rush out to buy tickets, saving a place in the queue for their friends. Oswald lets everyone else go first only to find they have sold out of tickets when it is his and Weenie’s turn. Distraught, Oswald turns to go home when he hears a stagehand struggling with a piano. Oswald kindly lends a hand and finds himself on stage with none other than Sammy Starfish! In fact, he ends up accompanying him on the piano!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Henry and Daisy stop talking to each other after a big argument and poor Oswald ends up being stuck in the middle. After many failed attempts to patch things between the quarrelsome duo. Oswald discovers it is only when he gets into a spot of trouble that Henry and daisy pull together to rescue him and they all become friends again.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Saffi declares that Wendy is her hero. She then tells the Spring City Rockets that her hero is going to build them a fancy tree house so that they can have their first ever club meeting. Wendy wants to live up to her hero status and re-organises the schedule so that the elaborate tree house is ready by the end of the day. But things don’t quite go to schedule when Saffi tries to help out. Saffi arranges furniture on wet paint and then causes Wendy to stick to adhesive. Things then get worse when Saffi uses the tree-house before it is ready, causing it to collapse. Now not only does Wendy have to save the collapsing tree-house but also the Rockets prize cup. With the help of Bob, Wendy dangles from a harness to retrieve the prize cup.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob takes Pilchard for her check-up, he discovers that the Vet Tilly is looking after a dog named Cooper... and he likes to chase cats. Vet Tilly panics as Mayor Madison is arriving that evening with her cat to be groomed. She doesn’t want Cooper to chase the Mayor’s cat! Bob suggests making a reception area that keeps cats and dogs separate and immediately the Vet commissions the build. Now working against the clock, Bob and the team have to complete the new reception area before the Mayor arrives. But on promising to keep the animals away from the building work, Leo accidentally lets Pilchard escape from her basket and doesn’t return to collect Cooper. Bob can’t continue his work until all the animals are out of the way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that everyone else can whistle but him… the birds, Little Grey Squirrel, Otter and even the wind in the river reeds. Inspired by the wind, he practices really hard and eventually learns to blow through a reed himself to make it whistle. He and his friends make a beautiful and eerie whistling symphony amongst the reeds.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare tries to jump high enough to reach a last Autumn apple on a high branch. Unable to reach it, even with the help of Little Field Mouse, he gives up. But after watching some little salmon struggling to swim up a waterfall he decides to ‘think like a fish’ and try, try, try again until he reaches the tasty prize.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare falls into a muddy Autumn puddle and is delighted when he startles Little Grey Squirrel, who doesn’t recognize him at first. This starts a great new game of ‘Surprise!’ as they dress up in disguises to surprise the others. But they weren’t ready for Little Field Mouse, who works out a clever way of surprising her friends even more.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are having a picnic. How many apples, cakes and drinks do they have?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The Pig Twins discover a puddle full of stranded goldfish. Huckle and his pals try to solve the mystery of where they came from. It turns out they were blasted out of the park fountain when an obstruction in the drain hole suddenly got unplugged./ A mysterious message on Sgt. Murphy’s radio has Huckle and the gang baffled!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy is playing with his toy planes, cars and boats and wonders how they all work, so he goes to Okido to find out! When he arrives, Felix and Zoe, they tell him to hurry because they want to watch the “All Okido Race to Windy Hill” with him. “There’s a mystery prize!” they tell him. Messy says they won’t watch the race… because they’re going to be in the race and win! He whistles over the Okidoodle and they skidoodle to the starting line!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy can’t reach a sock in the top drawer! He wonders if he’ll ever be tall enough.“When you need to know, go to Okido!” he says. Messy gets to Okido just in time to catch Felix and Zoe leaving to meet Zim, Zam and Zoom at the funfair! They jump into the Okidoodle, but Felix accidentally lets go of the funfair map, which flies away! Messy stops and luckily, Lofty the giant was there to catch it for them. Lofty is with his niece Mini, and so they invite her to the funfair with them. “Mini’s a bit too big for the Okidoodle” notices Messy, so she follows behind on her scooter.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Lemon and Raspberry make the final preparations for the contest. Strawberry offers the twins to be models at the contest instead of her. Sweet is delighted, but Sour is not excited. Shortly before the show is broadcast, Sour sabotages the TV equipment.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is reluctant to have a bath so he goes to Dino-World where he endeavours to become as dirty and stinky as he possibly can.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harrys friend Charlie brings her new kitten (Buster) to visit Harry.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari is collecting plant specimens at the nature reserves when suddenly she sees an interesting fallen plant nearby and examines it. Then, she sees a pregnant walking catfish squirming about on the path. Weirded out by a fish on land, she calls in the Junior Rangers for some assistance. At the garden, Leo And Katie are playing animal charades. Katie manages to guess Leos chimpanzee performance but Leo cant figure out her Moths performance. Their game is interrupted by Zari, asking their thoughts on the struggling fish. The Junior Rangers get to the treehouse and learn more about the animal in the picture, revealing it as a Walking Catfish. Katie warns Zari not touch it as the fish may sting her with the spike on its spine. Another catfish appears and moves fast, causing Zari to worried if the catfish could be injured. She asks the Junior Ranger to help and the Ranger agree before hoping into PlatypusOne. As they arrive to the scene, the Junior Ranger ask Zari. on the fishs status and Zari replied not that great. They then decide to help the animal get to the nearest body of water and think on how to get the fish into the bucket without getting close to it. While Zari go fill up the bucket with water, Leo grabs the fish with his Backpack Grabber. Zari returns with bucket of water but Leo is having difficulties of grabbing the slippery fish. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky emerge from a bush, surprising the Junior Rangers. He tells them that he was revealing to study tadpoles nearby before meeting them.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Gator is waiting to be loaded onto a ship, but the ship is delayed. So Gator is waiting around doing nothing. So when Oliver breaks down one night, Gator is very happy to help. He sets off to collect Oliver’s trucks and promises to bring them back before morning. But Gator’s lamp keeps going out and he decides not to stop or he will be late. Toad, the brake van, doesn’t think it is safe and they argue, but in the end it is Toad’s bright idea that helps Gator deliver the trucks in time.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Emily thinks all the other engines are pulling much more exciting loads then she is, so when she is given a huge globe to transport she decides to show it off. But as she heads off around the island, the huge globe gets knocked off her flatbed and rolls around causing confusion and delay before she manages to get it back again.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Maria ordered way too much stock and if she doesnt sell hundreds of pizzas today, everything will be ruined! Grisu offers to do some advertising to bring people in. After a shooting session, Grisu Stella and Fume distribute and stick flyers and posters around the city. But Fume overzealous sticks his posters anywhere. Grisu has to catch up with his fathers mistakes and ends up burning the cart full of flyers. After his despair moment, Grisu has the idea to do an air show. With his father, they draw a giant pizza in the sky, made with colored smoke...and it works.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Stella is taking part in a dance video contest and she asks Grisu to dance along with her. The young dragon accepts immediately. But as soon as they start filming, Fume comes in and asks his son to do dragon training with him. He then unwittingly makes Grisu fall and botches the shot. From then on, Stella and Grisu keep changing location so that they can shoot in a "quiet" place, meaning without Fume. But the older dragon shows up anyway and ruins the shot, albeit unvoluntarily.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse see a beautiful rainbow. When it disappears before Big Nutbrown Hare can see it, they recreate it for him with flowers.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger wants to sleep under the stars. Rosie is all for it, but Woodsy would rather not, confessing that he is scared. First,Scoutbadger makes fun of Woodsy, who doesn’t want to go with them. But as night falls, Scoutbadger grows scared. He believes he has seen a yellow-eyed monster and runs away, soon getting lost. Actually, the monster was only Edmund and Woodsy, who had discreetly come to see if everything wasgoing well.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has arranged for Ballroom Blitz, TV dance sensation, to come on tour to Spring City. When star dancer, Sylvain de Souza, threatens to cancel the show unless he gets a sprung dance floor, Maria enlists Bob to save the day, in return for a show tango with her hero. Dance fever sweeps Team Bob and the Spring City Rockets but Lofty despairs of ever being able to dance as well as the others. Just as he finds his dancing mojo, Lofty accidentally wrecks part of the sprung dance floor. Sylvain recognizes a kindred spirit in Lofty and urges him to follow his dreams, no matter how unlikely they may seem.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Mila is appearing on the children’s TV game show, “Whiz-A-Quiz”, the rest of the Spring City Rockets are disappointed that they didn’t get tickets to watch and support her. This gives Mayor Madison the idea for Bob to build an outdoor movie area at the Stadium where everyone can watch the game show together. But when Mayor Madison asks Lofty to help the Spring City Rockets decorate the stadium, he gets carried away and leaves Leo to finish the support frames for the giant screen all by himself. A job that is too big for one person. When the giant screen arrives, the frame isn’t sturdy enough to hold it and the whole structure starts falling apart. Lofty races in and saves the TV screen but the frame, stage and audience seating are broken.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Mr Frumble’s morning newspaper disappears off his front step, Huckle sets out to investigate what happened to it. After a number of other innocuous items ‘disappear’ from across town, Huckle ultimately discovers that the culprits are none other than Pig Will and Pig Won’t. They are enthusiastically taking part in Busytown’s Annual Recycling Drive by picking up anything they see that can be recycled./Huckle, Lowly and Sally happen upon a huge tooth and can’t imagine anyone in all of Busytown big enough to own it.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden is about to take a bite of his peanut butter sandwich before things take an unexpected turn when a crafty raccoon snatches his comms device. Simultaneously, Leo and Katie engage in a decluttering activity in the garden, pondering which possessions to keep or give away. They receive a call from Jayden but instead of seeing Jayden on the screen, it’s the raccoon on the run! Confused, this prompts the Junior Rangers swift response. They arrive and meet with a tired and lost Jayden who shows them the direction the raccoon went. This leads them near a road where the raccoon runs in the middle of it, which raises the rangers’ concerns about relocating the raccoon. They meet up with Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey to provide insights into raccoon behavior and habits. Jaydens ingenious use of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich to bait the raccoon into giving back the comms device works but Ranger Rocky intervenes and reminds them not to feed wildlife but the raccoon scurries off. The day concludes with a successful mission and Leo, Katie and Hero continue with sorting their stuff and Hero lets go of his unused toy.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah, navigating the scorching Thar Desert, finds Hardwickes Spiny-Tailed Lizards seemingly braving the intense heat. Concerned for their well-being, she contacts Leo and Katie who are in the garden about to commence in a water gun chase but are interrupted when Hero steals the water gun. Upon consulting the computer, they learn that the lizards need sunlight to regulate their body temperature. During the call, a falcon appears and scares the lizards back into their burrows! Leo, Katie and Hero fly to the desert to help the lizards find a way to stay in the sun without being harmed by the falcon. Attempting to aid them, they construct a tent, only for it to crash to their disappointment. They meet with Ranger Rocky who seeks advice from Ranger Joey, they discover the importance of sunlight for these cold-blooded creatures. A lizard approaches the rangers, trusting them enough to be around them when suddenly the falcon swoops in towards it! Hero intervenes to protect the lizard from the falcon and it flies off. With Ranger Rockys assistance, they come up with a new plan to keep the falcon away instead of protecting the lizards. With CDs hung on a tree, it reflects light which scares the falcon. The lizards can now safely bask in the sun, marking the success of the mission. In the Treehouse, a water gun fight ensues between Leo and Katie.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon trades his favorite cars with Ferdinand for the latter’s robot. But when he realizes the robot is broken, Simon wants his cars back. Ferdinand knew the robot was broken and he didn’t tell him! But Ferdinand refuses to give Simon back his cars “A gift is a gift!” Simon is crafty though and he gets his cars back by making Ferdinand believe there is something super cool hidden inside the robot!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: As the end of summer approaches, the Lightning Beetle visits the fireflies and surprises them with a new book about planets and stars. After a conversation, one little firefly, when the others were already asleep, sets out to conquer the sky, but becomes completely exhausted and crashes. Doctor Owl diagnoses him with a fever and possible pneumonia, so he stays with him to heal. The other fireflies decide to surprise him. With the help of Berry, Dolly, Balthazar, Stanley, Flutter, and Eddy, they make colourful orbs, and the Lightning Beetle crafts the Sun. They suspend the planets on a hoop, which Eddy rotates with a contraption. They also instal tiny lights, resembling stars.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly goes for a walk, and finally she is enriched with a beautiful cherry and a good friend.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry becomes sad because he can not climb on the rainbow but Dolly makes him happy with an exceptionally creative present.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 01 Mepe
programme.desc: The characters in the Berry and Dolly stories are a bunch of tiny bugs and beetles who live alongside one another in the forest. The stories are lead by the title characters: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird. A variety of other characters join them in their fun and games throughout the series with the stories set in their forest home. All the characters’ houses, belongings and clothes perfectly match their individual appearance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is disappointed he cant go play because hes all sneezy but Sula and Amma bring him a nice carroty bagel to help him get better.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide And Seek at the crèche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesn’t go to the toilet with all the others before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding place or try and hold on.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are making ginger bunny biscuits for Charlie and Coco.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert finds out that Molly has a beautiful singing voice and asks her if she can sing a song for Tildas birthday. Molly absolutely wants to do this but can she overcome her stage fright?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda launches an herbal delivery service, and demand is huge. But Billy and Benny mix up orders: now Rupert cant sleep, and Robin sleeps through his morning song. Tilda must fix the chaos.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds soapbox cars, and Billy and Benny race them excitedly. Edna thinks its too dangerous and secures the track, while Karl and Molly struggle with near-sightedness and fear.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare has a lot to do today. Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse promise to help but there are so many wonderful distractions they forget their promise and let Big Nutbrown Hare down. Luckily they learn a valuable lesson from some bees and get busy to make to things right!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Its Little Field Mouses birthday and Little Nutbrown Hare wants to give her exactly the right gift. After a moment’s thought he realises he has no idea what to give her. Big Nutbrown Hare encourages his son to think about everything he knows about his friend. He remembers she likes to look nice on her birthday, so her makes her a lovely necklace and she is delighted!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare keeps winning a game with Little Field Mouse, and enjoys it so much he doesnt realise she is frustrated with losing. Big Nutbrown Hare helps him realise that winning is less important than making sure everyone enjoys playing the game. So Little Nutbrown Hare invents a new game that Little Field Mouse and her twin siblings can enjoy playing too.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon brags to Ferdinand and Lou that he can do tons of stuff on his own, just like a big boy! But Gaspard catches him red-handed telling his tall tales. Simon tries to prove him wrong.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: An unusual guest shows up in Leo’s swimming pool—a dugong! Come along with the Junior Rangers as they seek a safe home for the dugong. But can they accomplish that while warding off a ship of dugong hunters?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A baby bottlenose dolphin is the last animal Leo expects to see in his garden pond. But when the unexpectable happens, the Junior Rangers start on an expedition to find the dolphin’s mother.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson has one hour to use the camera car to take pictures of three faults: one that’s up high, one that’s down low, and one that’s on something moving. Wilson spots a fault on something moving - Koko’s wagon - and wastes most of his time chasing her without ever getting a picture. Time’s up and Wilson thinks he’s failed his badge, as he’s only photographed two faults: a fallen signpost and faulty doors on a chute at the quarry. But Lori points out that not only is the chute is high up, but also its doors move – so that counts as two things and Wilson wins his badge!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn a passenger service badge, Wilson must speak up, be nice to his passengers, and smile at all times – no matter what happens! His passengers know that it’s a test, and go out of their way to make things very challenging for Wilson - but he keeps smiling and earns his badge.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi loves eating Fred’s goat’s cheese… but thinks again after getting a whiff of the goats’ pen: Ew!... So he’s very happy when Nina suggests they clean it out! Once they’re done with the cleaning, the two friends decide they could also make it more cozy. But shhh, not a word to anyone: it’s a surprise! However, after making the pen all spic and span and super comfortable, they’re shocked to find that the smell is still there!?! Thinking he’s found the perfect solution, Tchoupi sprays Mom’s perfume inside the pen… But what do the goats’ think of this new scent inside their house…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out walking in the forest, Benedicte sets a challenge for Tchoupi and Nina – to find their way back home all by themselves, using landmarks they come across along the way. But when they spot a squirrel, they momentarily forget to pay attention, and stray from the path back home...

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Loupiote the dog is feeling particularly playful this morning! She grabs T’choupi’s stuffed and runs off to bury it in a secret location! T’choupi manages to get his plush bear back… but its fur is covered in mud! Dad washes it… but now it’s all wet and will never be dry by tonight! Tchoupi feels down: how will he be able to sleep without his precious teddy bear?! He sets off on a quest to find a replacement… but comes back empty-handed. Nina thinks she just may have a solution: what if she were to teach him how to get to sleep… “Teddy-less?...!”

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Anna organises a workshop on shooting stars. Lily says you have to make a wish when you see one go by in the sky... So when Andy is injured because of Charleys fault, Charley has just one idea in mind: find a shooting star so that Andy can get better, and fast!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: In the courtyard, Sam and Julia have discovered that snowflakes are formed by beautiful little stars. But how can they preserve these wonders and show them to Julias mom before it melt?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have adopted a pumpkin theyve nicknamed Leo. But Sams dad is planning to make with it a delicious soup for the whole building. The two friends try anything they can to save him.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Which child will get the big spoon for the annual fondue held in memory of the very first residents of th Mouse Mansion. Sam and Julia are in competition, will their friendship hold up?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Diesel always likes to appear rough and tough in front of Arry and Bert. But when Thomas, unexpectedly, finds him lovingly fussing over some baby ducklings he threatens to tell everyone that Diesel is just a big softie. Diesel is horrified and promises to be nice to everyone in exchange for Thomas not telling anyone about the ducklings. All the engines are pleasantly surprised when Diesel starts being polite and friendly, but just how long can he keep it up?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The Troublesome Trucks are being particularly cheeky and disobedient. When a new brake van called Bradford arrives from The Mainland Thomas is delighted to work with him as Bradford is excellent at keeping The Troublesome Trucks under control. But Bradford is a real stickler for the rules, and Thomas soon tires of his petty regulations, which are always making him late.. Eventually Thomas is so fed up with Bradford that he decides to go off without a brake van, a reckless and dangerous move, which ends up with Thomas hurtling out of control down Gordon’s Hill with no brake van to stop him.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends organize their own sports day and even try the high jump!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: He’s back! Join Caillou, the lovable 4-year-old with a big imagination! Caillou experiences all the wonders of being a child that audiences around the world can relate to; learning at school, caring for a pet, playing with friends or spending time with family.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: One of Monkey’s favorite snow activities is to build snow monkeys an activity Polar bear was happy to participate in. He was even happier to play in Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey finds it is hard to build a sand castle and keep it whole especially when someone constantly makes holes in it… When monkey realizes that the naughty digger is his friend the Crab, monkey decides it is time for his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When beavers cause a power cut in Pontypandy, Norman suggests keeping Dilyss frozen food cold outside, which turns out to be a very, very bad idea

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy offers to look after Miss Pawdry, claiming that shes great with animals. But the cat escapes and ends up in a basket drifting towards the sea!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When Franklin sprains his ankle and has to wear a temporary brace on his leg, he quickly grows frustrated that he can’t do all the things he usually does – until he realizes it’s a chance to do new things and even play new games. / Green Wonder and the Super Cluepers are focused on solving the case of the missing school bell and some other cool mysteries around Woodland – until Franklin realizes that helping out and solving the unexpected problems right in front of them feels really good too.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie is overjoyed: today, shes throwing a great tea party! She’s been planning it for such a long time… But as she starts scratching herself, she understands to her dismay and with Bivas help that she’s got fleas. The two friends really dont want to cancel the party. They promise each other not to say a word to anyone, and hand out invitations as if nothing had happened.But when you’re feeling so itchy, it’s not that easy to hide you have fleas… Soon, Rosie’s secret is uncovered.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who loves to learn new tricks ? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Dolphin.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What do you need for a great birthday? Doodleboo explains how to draw a birthday cake.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What doesnt have feathers and can fly silently like a bird? Doodleboo explains how to draw a ladybug.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Hatty find his matching green ice skate. Understanding that a pair is two things that look the same and go together, they have fun matching pairs by shape, size and colour. They eventually find Hatty’s missing skate at the ice rink next to two a pair of identical snowmen. And there’s still time to look for two pairs of hockey sticks and team up in pairs to enjoy a game of ice hockey!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave put on a show for Hilda the Cow, to thank her for all her hard work down on the farm. They make up a play about Hilda planning a dance party for all her friends and choose costumes, props and sound effects to help tell their story. Tweet directs the action, Ruff-Ruff plays Farmer Fred and Dave stars as Hilda the Cow. Despite some mishaps the show is a triumph and Hilda is inspired to throw a real party!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very special feather with bright colours, spots and soft tickly bits. Just as he shows off to his friends how it can fly and float, a cheeky bird flies away with it. Little Grey Squirrel climbs her tree and discovers the bird using it to feather her nest. Will Little Nutbrown Hare find a way to get his feather back, or will he decide that the bird needs it more than he does?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. All his friends admire the interesting little creature and he feels very special indeed. When she eventually flies away Little Nutbrown Hare follows her, wanting her back. But he understands why she left when he discovers she has lots of tiny spotty babies.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It is a sunny Spring day in the meadow and Little Nutbrown Hare is enjoying all it has to offer. programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Nuair a tha Bing a’ cluich geama le fòn-làimhe Flop, chaneil rudan a’ dol mar bu chòir oir tha am fòn-làimhe a briseadh nuair a tha e dol na sgeing air an làr. When Bing is playing a game with Flop’s mobile phone, he accidentally drops the mobile and it breaks. Instead of telling Flop, he throws it in the bin. He feels upset about it all and learns that it’s best to tell the truth.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing tries to show Sula she doesnt need to wear earmuffs to watch the fireworks but when a loud bang sends Bing flying, he doesnt think they are such a bad idea!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is sad when his new orange balloon pops so Flop helps him make a Bye Bye Box, a memory box for broken toys too special to throw away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Leapy the grasshopper makes fun of Katie the yellow ladybird, because she blows bigger bubbles than her. Later, regretting her actions, Leapy has to find a way to apologize to Katie.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Dolly accidentally knocks over a glass of water on Berrys painting. The colors on Berrys painting get faint and watery. Berry gets mad at Dolly for ruining his painting. Later Berrys friends admire the little snails unique style of painting, so he insists that it was his idea to make the painting like this. But then Dolly arrives and sheds light to Berrys lies.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Dolly leaves for and adventure with Harry Hedgehog, so she asks Bubbles to take care of her flowers while shes gone. Bubble forgets to water them, so they quickly wither. Now Bubble has to find a way to make the flowers bloom again.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The residents of the forest decide to celebrate the last day of the year with music. The ants form a choir, Dr Owl becomes the conductor, and all the little bugs create instruments for themselves. But Iris, the icebeetle loses her bells, so everyone starts to help her find them.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Walking on stilts is difficult even for a talented athlete like Monkey; And it is even more difficult if one stilts breaks and the other gets stuck in the mud…but not to worry, Flamingo is here to save the day. programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads a group hike to the beaver dam and Pontypandy Mountain, but without using a compass or a map either.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads a group hike to the beaver dam and Pontypandy Mountain, but without using a compass and soon without a map, either!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Moths are spoiling an outdoor dinner for Kate and her parents. In Mimiloo, all of Kate’s friends are hiding from a dragon that’s after Gobble’s moon flowers! But when the dragon turns out to be more friendly than fearsome, Kate leads her friends on a quest to help the dragon find its way home.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to fix her pop-up book without Mom’s help. In Mimiloo, everyone’s preparing to watch the butterfly flowers fly away after sunset. To get a good view, Tack tries to build a lighthouse all by himself—but loses his light bulb in the process! Kate must convince him that he needs his friends’ help to get his lighthouse working.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are having fun discovering various animals’ houses. When they realize butterflies don’t have a house, they decide to build a beautiful "Butterfly Hotel!" But when the edifice is finally ready… another animal - one that is not at all to T’choupi’s liking - moves in instead!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Nina asks T’choupi to accompany her to the forest for a fitness session, our little hero gets very excited… until they reach the location and there’s no fitness trail in sight! Nina laughs: that’s the funnest part about it - they’ll use the tree trunks, boulders and branches to make their own parcourse! T’choupi drags his heels as he follows Nina through the "trail." Then, when he trips and falls, he wants to call it quits… But what if he were to invent his very own fitness trail in the forest? Wouldn’t that be fun…?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia dreams of joining the residences brass band, except that to do so, she must come with a musical instrument. Sam builds one for her, but Julia is too impatient to listen at her friends advice.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia and Sam must babysit Ben. A game of hide and seek is launched in the residence. But Sams little brother is so well hidden that he cant be found. Where could he be hiding?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: A tiring gardening session make the friends of Wild Rose Lane dream of going away on holiday. But none of them wants to be all alone in far-off places. So Tilda suggests that they simply swap homes. No sooner said than done! Tilda moves in to Ednas, Molly to Ruperts, Robin to Tildas, the squirrels to Mollys and Rupert to Robins.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: In Grandpa’s garden, Turbulent is fascinated by the super heroes’ stories he can read in his book. He wishes too to be a Kind Vigilante who saves the lovely and the helpless. Unfortunately, every time he tries to save someone, his sister who stucked her kite in a tree or his brother who is afraid of a spider for example, Grandpa always comes first and fixes the problem. When Turbulent was at the most discouraging point, a new villain appears ant kidnap all the people he loves, the Kind Vigilante is back in business!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are playing in the park when Mommy calls them because it’s time to go home. When they arrive she asks them if Toto is not with them but the Triplets thought he was already with Mommy! What a disaster! Toto is lost! It’s the total panic, the Triplets are desperate and worst, the park is about to close! Everyone starts to look for Toto, Grandpa makes the tour of the neighborhood, Mommy hangs signs everywhere and calls the Police. We absolutely need to find him !

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Watching Scoutbadger practicing his walk on his homemade stilts, Rosie keeps bragging that she has the best balance ever. Meanwhile, Loudo and Woodsy accidentally hit a bird’s nest with their long fishing rod and the nest threatens to tip over! The group of friends asks Rosie for help: they need her to climbup the tree and save the nest… But when the little vixen finds herself in a difficult situation, she realizes that she might have been bragging a little too hard about her tightrope walker talents.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: After the tree in the garden falls down during a storm, the family reminisces about all their favorite memories with the tree. In a series of flashbacks we see the day they first got Gilbert and how the tree made Gilbert feel at home, the day Rosie first came home from the hospital and wouldnt stop crying until Caillou held her while sitting under the tree, and the day Mommy planted the tree while pregnant with Caillou.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to a fancy new Restaurant with his family, but isreluctant to try new things - until the Chef makes him the best mealhes ever had!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A new tunnel-boring machine called Darcy arrives on Sodor. She has come to work on the new road being built by Miss Jenny’s Construction Crew and is eager to impress her new friends. She makes several mistakes, and worries she doesn’t fit in with the other engines. Nia encourages Darcy to be herself and she soon makes up for her mistakes when everyone sees what she can really do!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko finds a lost puppy and wants to keep it. Convinced she can look after him and practice the new task -delivering newspapers - Koko soon runs into trouble. Zoomy needs lots of attention, food and walks. With all the extra work, Koko will never be able to get the hang of the throwing arm to deliver the newspapers into their boxes! Eventually Koko finds a way for the puppy to help her with her practice. They’re a great team! Then one of the newspapers blows open - and there is a picture of a lost puppy. It’s Zoomy!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: On her way to see a lamb at the farm, Zephie gets lost! She shouts for help and rings her little bell, but no one hears her. Morgan fits her with a siren so that she can call for help if it ever happens again. Zephie falls in love with her new accessory and can’t resist playing with it and setting the siren off - much to the annoyance of the other chuggers. She is reminded that the siren is for emergencies only - so there is only one thing for it, she must find some emergencies. In her mind, a snoring Irving is an escaped lion, and a squirrel keeping still in a tree must be stuck.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Anna organises a workshop on shooting stars. Lily says you have to make a wish when you see one go by in the sky... So when Andy is injured because of Charleys fault, Charley has just one idea in mind: find a shooting star so that Andy can get better, and fast!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave learn how to keep score when they compete in Hatty’s Game Show. There’s lots of fun to be had in two quick-fire question rounds, a singing competition, a Rollypod race and an egg and spoon race ... but who will win? Ruff-Ruff discovers you don’t always have to be the fastest to win!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are busy playing as the chickens roam free in the orchard, pecking for food. But when it comes to bringing the birds back home, they notice Picorette is missing! They manage to track her down, nestling nice and cozy inside Loupiote the dog’s kennel, of all places! She’s come here to lay her eggs and she intends to stay! T’choupi and Nina try to coax her out with various treats… in vain. The problem is, Loupiote is out of a home right now!... But what if they were to find her another kennel??

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this rainforest adventure, Peyo, while collecting colorful flowers, encounters a tiny, vibrant Poison Dart Frog. Pico goes into protective mode, preventing Peyo from getting too close to the potentially dangerous frog. He calls Leo and Katie, who checks on the computer and learns about Poison Dart Frogs, emphasizing their toxic nature. The frog suddenly jumps into Peyo’s satchel which calls for the team to travel to the rainforest to address the situation. As they arrive, Leo manages to get the frog out of the satchel with his grabber but the frog ends up jumping around which causes a commotion with everyone being scared to get too close. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky shows up and the frog is nowhere to be found! On high alert, they look around for the frog which ends up being on Ranger Rocky’s hat which he gently places on the ground and Peyo retrieves his satchel safely. However, the frog then jumps onto Hero’s backpack and gets flung onto a floating leaf in a river, prompting a rescue mission as they learnt that the frog is not a good swimmer. Using quick thinking and Peyo’s satchel, the Junior Rangers save the frog and find a suitable spot for it to rest by the river. Back in the Treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the frog while Katie commends Hero’s smelling skills and deems them better than Leo’s.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.desc: When a comedy of errors causes Orange, Plum and Cherry to arrive late to their campout, they start off their annual tradition of telling tall-tales around the campfire by making up three outrageous, hysterical accounts of what held them up.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Right before they go to bed, the Fox-Badger family dreamily gazes at the snowflakes falling from the sky. Berry would like togo out and build a snowman, but its late. Scoutbadger, Woodsy and Rosie promise that they will make one all together the next morning… Alas! When they wake up the next day, they realize that the snow has already melted.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. When Little Nutbrown Hare finds a beautiful blue butterfly, he and Little Field Mouse go on a hunt for other blue treasures to bring back and show Big Nutbrown Hare, including blueberries, blue bells and even blue eggshells. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes early one Summer morning before the sun has risen. Big Nutbrown Hare sends Little Nutbrown Hare off to invite his friends for breakfast so he can rest a little longer. Along the way Little Nutbrown Hare discovers how wonderful and different all his friends homes are. Will Little Nutbrown Hare still love his own home as much as he did?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Annalee and Boribon go on a hike. Annalee fills her backpack, and they set off to climb a mountain. When they reach the top and the strange rock, an interesting view unfolds before them. However, on the way back, a small accident happens…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia want to play as if they own a restaurant. But its not so easy to decide on the menu, the name of the place, and to manage their first difficult customers, Ella and Tonio.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: While playing against Tonio, Julia lost Sams beautiful marble. The two mice do everything to recover it, but Julia would like to understand why this marble was so precious to him...

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: While buying pastries at Mrs Bun’s bakery, mom puts up a flyer for a babysitter. A baby sitter for the Triplets? « Out of the question! », reply the three kids in unison. After making sure that the first applicants never manage to reach their mom on the phone, Eliott, a teenage boy, gets to try out for the job. But the Triplets have more than one trick up their sleeves and have decided to drive the poor Eliott completely crazy. Mom comes home to a most surprising scene: the poor boy is asleep on the couch and the triplets are quietly playing cards.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Poet was quietly sitting on the pot when he suddenly heard a horrible sound and quickly ran away, convinced that a dragon was hiding in the toilet. The triplets called their Grandpa for help, but he only managed to stop the roaring temporarily. "He must be hungry", suggests Girl, so why not feed him the roast? Another miss, but Toto had a feast! Good thing Mom called a real dragon hunter to the rescue, a "plumber", and everything returns to normal. There is just one slight problem: there is nothing left for dinner!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko is thrilled that she is going to be spending the day training with Daley – the express courier. She watches him pick up and deliver various items all around Chuggington. As theyre heading to the docks to collect a part for the repair shed, Daley is called to another urgent job. He can’t be in two places at once, so Koko offers to go to the docks. She speeds in and picks up the first freight case she sees, but later discovers it’s the wrong one.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads a group hike to the beaver dam and Pontypandy Mountain, but without using a compass or a map either.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads a group hike to the beaver dam and Pontypandy Mountain, but without using a compass and soon without a map, either!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to make lemonade that both looks and tastes great. In Mimiloo, Lily has opened her dream cafe, and wants everything to be perfect for a visit from the Queen of the Bunniflies. But when some of her preparations fall apart, it’s up to Kate to show her that things don’t have to be perfect to be great.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to win at pin the tail on the donkey, but she misses. In Mimiloo, Kate and Mim-Mim want to race against their new friend, Auggie the Froggie, in a leapfrog race. Tack gives Kate a pair of Hoppy Socks so she can jump above Mim-Mim, but they give her an unfair advantage!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou gets the giggles at school, his silliness disrupts the rest of the class. In a rodeo fantasy, an announcer’s (Leo) silly antics are distracting to Buck Buckaroo (Caillou), and Caillou learns that being silly is great, but sometimes you have to shake your sillies out for your friends.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Daddy has to stop playing with Caillou and Leo to run an errand, the boys try to stop Daddy from leaving. Then in a farmer fantasy where a farmer and his farm hand (Caillou and Leo) are bombarded by clingy sheep, Caillou and Leo learn that they can have fun while they wait for Daddy to return.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Henry hears that the Fat Controller’s grandchildren have chickenpox, he starts to worry about whether engines can get chickenpox too. Then he meets Thomas who has been splattered with mud and is carrying a wagon of chickens, and becomes convinced of it! It seems like every engine Henry meets is splattered with something that looks like spots and it’s not until the end of the day that poor Henry discovers that chickenpox is not really a problem for engines after all!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo spots a South African cheetah cub in his garden. The Junior Rangers journey to the savannah to locate the cheetah cub’s mother, but the cheetah cub is captured halfway by illegal hunters. Will the Junior Rangers have enough speed to catch up with these criminals?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo discovers a reef manta ray pup in the garden. The Junior Rangers set sail to find the manta ray a home in the ocean, but what happens when Ranger Rocky gets stuck in a sea jelly bloom?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Ranger Rocky entrusts the Junior Rangers with a mission—return a mola to the ocean! The Junior Rangers take up the challenge, but find themselves having to wing it when some seagulls start pecking the mola.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pats special mission is to deliver a family of hibernating fruit bats to Amy.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat must find some missing duck eggs before they start to hatch, and get them to Amy.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely ‘poiky thing’ in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle not realizing it belongs to Pando’s digger.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and the gang are eagerly making preparations for the following day’s Big City Autumn Festival. There is a lot of excitement and activity in the air and once the preparations have been made everyone retires for the night in eager anticipation of the next day. The following morning, however, they wake up to find it has snowed overnight, making plans for a Big City Autumn Festival seem ruined. But ever the optimist, Oswald shows everyone that they can have an even better time in the snow.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie catch a firefly in Big City Park and get their chance to make a wish. But making a wish is a lot harder than they think – after all, they love everything they already have. After a whole day and night of not being able to make up their minds, Oswald and Weenie return to the Park only to find that all of the other fireflies have disappeared! Only then does Oswald realise what the wish should be.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is looking after Curtis’s garage while Leo takes him out for a birthday meal at Chef Tattie’s. However, the meal is a ruse, arranged so that Bob and his gang can secretly give Curtis’ workshop a makeover. Scoop is excited to be at the garage; he claims to have a great knowledge of mechanics. The build is all on schedule until Bob is forced to attend to Mr Bentley who keeps him busy because he’s very fussy about how much air he has in Philip’s tyres. At the restaurant Curtis is keen to get back to the garage as he is nervous about leaving it in somebody else’s hands. When Bob rings Leo and asks him to play for time Leo orders more and more food for himself to eat. At the, now busy, garage Scoop decides to take a look at what’s troubling Betsy, using the new vehicle inspection lift.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are building Spring City’s new Ice Rink when the Rockets arrive and plead with him to finish it as soon as possible. They explain that the rink they were going to be playing on that evening is out of action and they have no-where to play! Bob tells them he’ll do his best and the building begins. Muck is fascinated by the idea of Ice Hockey and when Bob and Wendy set off to get the clear plastic panels to fit in the barrier surrounds, Muck decides to have a little go himself. Despite Leo’s protestations, all the machines are soon skidding about on the ice causing mayhem! When Bob and Wendy arrive back, they are alarmed to see all the barriers knocked down! Muck says sorry but Bob knows that the Rockets will be back very soon and they need to work fast.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Autumn day Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse convince Little Grey Squirrel to leave his pile of spotted acorns unattended, so they can all play with the crunchy leaves. While they’re gone Little Redwood Fox discovers the yummy acorns and takes them home. Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: It’s dressing up time and Timmy plays Doctor! Poor Teddy is sick, can you help Timmy put some plasters on Teddy to make him better?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids find some numbered papers blowing around the park. After investigating several possibilities of where they could be from, they finally figure out they were once fastened to trees in the park as part of a self-guided tour to celebrate Arbor Day. / When all the milk in Huckle’s Dad’s store turns out to be sour, Huckle, Sally and Lowly set out to find out why.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy is in his kitchen and he is really hungry… His tummy thinks it’s lunchtime already! “My tummy’s not very good at telling the time” he says, “but what is time anyway? Hm, when you need to know, go to Okido!” He lands with a jump in Zoe and Felix’s garden just in time to go to the lab to see what Zim and Zam’s amazing discovery is! They jump into the Okidoodle and go to the Cloudship to find Zim, Zam and Zoom with loads of clocks and the amazing discovery, which is… a door. The trio look unimpressed. But it turns out to be a time machine!

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Its the Okido Circus today and Messy is worried about performing his tripple flip. Will his friends be able to help him conquer his tummy flutters before the audience arrives?

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The twins birthday is approaching. Sour says she does not wish to share the birthday with Sweet. Sweet is sad that her sister feels that way but respects her wish. Sour initially enjoys having a birthday of her own and the activities the Berry girls plan for her, but gradually feels lonely without her sister, and regrets what she said earlier.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is disappointed to find that he is not able to join in with any of the activities his family are taking part in at home.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is told to tidy his room he simply transfers all the mess into Dino-world, where he is told there is a no tidying up rule.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai was enjoying his time by the river, playing with a drone and conducting experiments with his unique smelling bombs. After a brief test that resulted in the area being engulfed in a green cloud, Kai noticed a peculiar creature emitting a peppery scent, prompting him to contact the Junior Rangers for assistance. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie engaged in a friendly competition, trying to determine whether their dog, Hero, would show more interest in his toy or a delicious treat. However, when they called Hero to make his choice, he disregarded both options. Suddenly, Leo received a call from Kai, who informed them about the mysterious creature he had encountered. Utilizing Katies computer, they identified it as a Giant Japanese Salamander. Upon learning that the salamander was trapped and potentially in danger, the Junior Rangers hurried to Kais location. Once there, they collaborated to move a rock, enabling the salamander to escape. However, they noticed that one of its feet had become detached. Concerned for the salamanders well-being, they embarked on a mission to find the missing limb. Fortunately, they encountered Ranger Rocky, who happened to be nearby. They explained the situation, leading Ranger Rocky to contact his colleague, Ranger Joey, for additional assistance. Ranger Joey enlightened them about the salamanders ability to regenerate its legs, relieving everyones worries about its condition.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: One day Bill and Ben tell Timothy he needs to find a truck that is blue and red and yellow and brown. Bill and Ben insist the truck is real, so Timothy sets off to look for it. Bill and Ben think they are very funny, but Timothy has the last laugh when he actually finds some trucks that match their description and brings back smelly rubbish trucks bound for the dump.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Marion has been digging along the mainline and is spending the night sleeping on a siding. A sound wakes her up and she sees a long line of dinosaurs going past in the moonlight! Marion thinks it must be a dream and tells Thomas as much the next day, but then the dinosaurs return and chase Marion all that way up to the castle. Where, thankfully, she discovers that they’re actually model dinosaurs for the Earl’s new Dinosaur Park!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Some sheeps escaped from Mr. Guellecs field. The farmer is torn as he cant watch the herd and fix the broken fence which allows the sheep to run away at the same time.Its a perfect mission for Grisu who will learn to be a shepherd, with Stellas help. But the task isnt a piece of cake since the sheep dont want to listen to him at all. They rush away throughout the streets of Dragontown, causing troubles. Grisu and Stella have to discover how to steer a herd, especially a stubborn black sheep. Not an easy mission but as ever, a fire fighter never gives up!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The Dragon Stone, a beautiful and rare stone that Grisus ancestors found centuries ago breaks accidently. It was supposed to be the main stone of an exhibition that Professor Smeraldo has set up. To avoid cancelling the exhibition, Grisu, Fume and Stella go to explore a cave where they might find another legendary Dragon Stone. But the expedition turns into an adventure when they realize that only the two kids are able to go through the very small entrance of the cave. The quest quickly appears to be a big task for such young kids, even if one of them is a dragon. But thanks to their tenacity (fire-fighters never give up!), Grisu and Stella will be able to find the legendary stone and to find their way back. The exhibition will be saved!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse and Little Nutbrown Hare’s favourite tree falls over in a summer storm. Theyre sad until they discover the fallen tree provides an exciting new place to explore.

programme.title: Enrico Caruso – La voix eternelle
programme.desc: Enrico Carusos life was as melodramatic as the plots of many of the operas he sang. His phenomenal tenor voice made him famous worldwide and he became the first superstar. The background to a hitherto little-known assassination attempt in Cuba sheds new light on the legendary voice of the century, which is now part of humanitys cultural heritage. Enrico Caruso is a phenomenon, produced by Italian opera at the end of the 19th century. And to this day it remains its greatest mystery. How was a child from a poor background able to celebrate such great successes at the Metropolitan Opera in New York? What is the basis of his myth?Subtitles available for this program with your remote control

programme.title: Electronic Vibrations - A sound changes the world
programme.desc: Whether techno or hip-hop – electronic music is nowadays the driving force of pop culture. We have almost forgotten that its origins lie in the WDR’s electronic studio, which made Cologne to one of the centres of the avant-garde during the post-war years. This is the story of how a room full of strange devices would become a cabinet of curiosities, the vibrations of which sent the whole world in a state of ecstasy. From the beginnings directly after the Second World War in Paris with Pierre Schaeffer’s ‘musique concrète’, the film focuses on Stockhausen and goes on to Kraftwerk, from Jean-Michel Jarre and the IRCAM studio right up to Detroit to the beginnings of techno.Subtitles available for this program with your remote control

programme.title: Rivalites musicales - Callas contre Tebaldi
programme.desc: Maria Callas and Renata Tebaldi were the two most famous sopranos of the second half of the last century. Turned into hostile enemies by their admirers, the two became untouchable goddesses of opera. For their fans, Callas was known as "the tigress", Tebaldi as "the voice of an angel": the two singers could hardly have been more different, whether in their professional or private lives. To this day, Callas remains perhaps the greatest soprano of all time. Her rival, Tebaldi, is best known to opera lovers. Why is the posthumous fame of the two prima donnas so different?Subtitles available for this program with your remote control

programme.title: Le Paradis perdu, un portrait dArvo Part
programme.desc: He is the most performed contemporary composer in the world. Nevertheless, he also rarely ventures out in public, keeps quiet about his music, feels at home in the forests of Estonia and generates therewith – perhaps involuntarily – the impression of a recluse, which is attributed to him again and again: Arvo Part.The Estonian composer, who will celebrate his 90th birthday on September 11, 2025, verily exudes even solely by his appearance an aura of a mystic or an ascetic. He himself says: “I am no prophet, no cardinal, not a monk, not even a vegetarian.” But he is without a doubt a devout man, who has been a member of the Russian Orthodox Church since 1970, and under pressure from the Soviet apparatus of power was forced to leave his native Estonia in 1980. Via Vienna he arrived in Berlin, which for the next 30 years would become his second home and also the starting point for his international career.“The Lost Paradise” is the first international documentary about Arvo Part. It is quite an astonishment that such a shy artist has given his consent to be accompanied by a camera for an entire year: In his native Estonia, travelling to Germany, Italy, and Japan, where Part received the Praemium Imperiale, the world’s most prestigious award in the field of music, in October 2014.The film is framed by the identically named stage production “Adam’s Passion,” featuring three key works by Arvo Part, which American director Robert Wilson brought to the stage in May 2015 in a former submarine factory, the “Noblessner Foundry” in Tallinn.
